pym.tenants.manager module¶

pym.tenants.manager.add_user(sess, tenant, user, owner, **kwargs)¶

Adds a user to tenant’s group.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • tenant – ID, name, or instance of a tenant.
  • user – ID, principal, or instance of a user.
  • owner – ID, principal, or instance of a user.
pym.tenants.manager.collect_my_tenants(sess, user_id)¶

Returns list of tenants to which given user belongs.

Each tenant has a global group with the same name. Membership in those groups determines whether a tenant is listed here or not.

Parameters:
  • sess – Instance of a DB session.
  • user_id – ID of user.
Returns:

List of tenants.
pym.tenants.manager.create_tenant(sess, owner, name, cascade, **kwargs)¶

Creates a new tenant record.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • owner – ID, principal, or instance of a user.
  • name – Name.
  • cascade – True to also create a group and resource for this tenant.
  • kwargs – See Tenant.
Returns:

Instance of created tenant.
pym.tenants.manager.delete_tenant(sess, tenant, deleter, delete_from_db=False)¶

Deletes a tenant.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • tenant – ID, name, or instance of a tenant.
  • deleter – ID, principal, or instance of a user.
  • delete_from_db – Optional. Defaults to just tag as deleted (False), set True to physically delete record from DB.
Returns:

None if really deleted, else instance of tagged tenant.
pym.tenants.manager.update_tenant(sess, tenant, editor, **kwargs)¶

Updates a tenant.

For details about **kwargs, see Tenant.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • tenant – ID, name, or instance of a tenant.
  • editor – ID, principal, or instance of a user.
Returns:

Instance of updated tenant.
